summary:
Over 12 years of IT experience with expertise in Telecommunication domain. This includes more than 5 years of international work experience in UK and Netherlands. I have experience of working across wide-ranging and challenging projects for varied lines of business for KPN like Wholesale & Retail KPN and BT like Retail, Business, Wholesale, Design and Managed Services.

Currently, I am working with KPN for operational process simplification and cost reduction in their copper network access domain. Key areas of transformation include service delivery, service assurance and customer network migration.

In my other experiences:
1.	Assisted BT Business for the launch of their cloud based voice product by managing the completion of Test & Trials phase.
2.	Worked with BT Managed Services as a Data Migration Designer, to deliver customer data migration capability for Everything Everywhere’s IT transformation program.
3.	Worked with BT Wholesale to deliver the P&L analysis of Ethernet product.
4.	Team Lead and Business Analyst for BT’s CRM and Work Force Management System (IBM Mainframe).

My key consulting skills include business transformation & process optimization, operational excellence & cost reduction and business analysis & business process redesign. My key functional skills include customer requirement capturing, system impact analysis and system designing for service delivery and service assurance.

school.name: Biju Patnaik University of Technology, Odisha

awards.title: Valuable Team Player
awards.description: For noteworthy performance in the data migration project

awards.title: Pat On The Back
awards.description: For delivering excellent quality of development work packages

profile_positions.description:
As a Business Consultant, I assist KPN with business transformation of their copper network access domain, with the aim of achieving operational process simplification and cost reduction.

Responsibilities:

1.	Process simplification and cost reduction in copper network access domain. Key areas of transformation include service delivery, service assurance and customer network migration.
2.	Assessment of existing operational landscape and identification of process & operational waste.
3.	Identification of innovative and improvement ideas to realize the ultimate business objective.
4.	Implementation of identified solutions with clear mandate of realizing operational cost reduction and business benefits within a defined timeframe.
5.	Change management for the faster implementation of identified solutions.
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As a Business Consultant, I had worked with BT Business to manage Test & Trials for the launch of their cloud based voice product (BT Cloud Voice).

Responsibilities:

1.	Managed Test & Trials for the new product launch.
2.	Defect Management of Test & Trials and providing sign-off for go-live.
3.	Defining KPIs and the entry & exit criterias for all the Test & Trial phases.
4.	Identifying the manual scenarios and defining the required operational processes.
5.	Identifying the business exceptions/fallouts and defining the required operational processes.
6.	Defining business KPIs and governance framework including RACI & operating model.
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As a Business Analyst, I had worked with BT Wholesale to implement the P&L (Profit & Loss) analysis for Ethernet product.

Responsibilities:
1.	To understand the AS-IS ecosystem (business processes and IT) and identifying possible sources of revenue leakage and system inconsistencies.
2.	Data extraction from different systems, identifying data attributes and performing data quality analysis.
3.	To perform RCA and suggest corrective actions to bridge the gap between financial based P&L view and inventory based P&L view.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
As a Data Migration Designer, I had worked with BT Managed Services to deliver the data migration capability for customer data migration from the legacy IT stack to the strategic IT stack.

Responsibilities:

1.	Defining and managing the scope of data migration for the legacy and strategic CRM and billing system.
2.	To develop and implement the data mapping rules for migration of customer’s CRM and Billing data.
3.	Defining the data extraction rules for the legacy stack and data transformation rules for data load into the strategic stack.
4.	Defining the data cleansing requirements - scope, business rules for cleansing and testing strategy.
5.	Managing the delivery of migration design until implementation.
profile_positions.title: Data Migration Designer

profile_positions.location: Mumbai (India), Milton Keynes (United Kingdom), London (United Kingdom)
profile_positions.description:
As a Team Lead, I had managed the application development for BT’s CRM and Work Force Management System (IBM Mainframe). Initially, I was working in this project as a developer and then as a module lead.

Responsibilities:

1.	Providing consultancy and support to the solution design team, the process team and the E2E test team.
2.	Evaluation of customer requirements and preparing system design.
3.	Maintaining the development work stack and monitoring the progress.
4.	Handling client communications related to the progress of ongoing work.
5.	Coordination with multiple teams for the development work deliveries.
6.	Quality related activities - Internal Quality Audits, Project Management Reviews, Defect Prevention Meetings, etc.
7.	Mentoring team members and managing their training.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead and Business Analyst
